title: Boku took too much money out
body:
Anyone else have this issue before? they took 23 dollars out when I bought 12 dollars mobile credit
Phone number says they are open mon-fri 9-5, so need to wait til monday to fix it.

edit: website is useless, so have to ring.

replies.body:
Hey there,

I'd suggest [submitting a support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new) with Riot and contacting Boku themselves, I'd also recommend viewing your transaction history with Boku to ensure you haven't accidentally charged more than expected.

https://boku.zendesk.com/entries/25707086-How-can-I-view-my-Boku-transaction-history-

I have contacted Boku and made a ticket, just posted here out of frustration.
Boku page claims 12 dollars only, and telstra app shows I only authorized 12 dollars premium SMS. Telstra system says it took out more.
I will contact OCE Riot if they don't refund in the next few days (even if they illegal claim they take no responsibility for 3rd party payments, ACCC wink wink).
Is it possible that the charge was made in USD rather than AUD? I've never used mobile payments so I'm unsure of the specifics.
Got a sms this morning, ran out of credit, telstra claim they took every cent from my account, pretty annoyed.
